meanings.definition: To burn (a dead body) to ashes.
meanings.sent1: They will crem the deceased at the funeral.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to cremate their loved one's body.
meanings.sent3: The cremation process turned the body into ashes.
meanings.sent4: The flames cremed the body, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The fire's intense heat slowly cremed the body, transforming it into dust.

meanings.definition: The act of cremating a dead body.
meanings.sent1: The crem was a solemn event for the family.
meanings.sent2: Crem is a common practice in some cultures.
meanings.sent3: The crem took place at the funeral home.
meanings.sent4: Witnessing the crem made him reflect on life's fragility.
meanings.sent5: The crem ceremony was a respectful farewell to the departed.

meanings.definition: The remains of a dead body after cremation.
meanings.sent1: The crem was placed in a decorative urn.
meanings.sent2: The family scattered the crem in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: She kept the crem on a shelf as a memorial.
meanings.sent4: The crem was a symbol of the loved one's memory.
meanings.sent5: The crem was a peaceful reminder of the departed's presence.
